title: Tom Jones speaks about his exit from The Voice: 'I would have liked to have known a bit earlier' - Showbiz
text: Tom Jones has opened up about his exit from The Voice and his relationship with his wife.In tonight's (October 17) episode of The Jonathan Ross Show, the singer revealed his son Mark, who's also his manager, received the call from the BBC while they were walking together in London. © BBCThe Voice, Final: Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Stevie McCrorie, Ricky Wilson, Rita Ora "I would have liked to have known a bit earlier because my agent is always saying, 'Are you doing The Voice? What are we doing?' and they always leave it to the last minute," he commented."They always did every year and then all of a sudden we'd pencilled it in thinking we were going to do it again."He also recalled his wife Linda's reaction to the news, once he'd told her that Boy George was replacing him."She said, 'I hope you didn't go off about Boy George?' I said, 'Of course not, I even said how much I like his records' and she said, 'Well you didn't have to go that far!'" © Getty Images / Tristan Fewings Ross moved on to ask Jones about his relationship with his wife and his affairs."She beat me up one night because a thing came out in the newspaper," Jones recalled. "I think she was more bothered because it was in the press. If it had just been between us, we could have dealt with it much easier."He also noted that she would "chin me" when Ross asked if they had a deal regarding the affairs. © PA ImagesTom Jones in 1965 Jones concluded by saying that when he sings, he only ever thinks of Linda."I don't want to go on about it but she wasn't well a while ago and we didn't know whether she was going to make it or not," he said."I said to Mark, 'If your mother doesn't make it, I don't know whether I can sing' because a lot of the songs I do, I think of her when I do it so it would be hard if she wasn't there to be able to sing."The Jonathan Ross Show airs tonight at 10.15pm on ITV.
